ratings.comment: Sara is a great professor! However she is one of those professors that will make you buy her book to read for class. The entire class is based around the book so if you don't read you won't pass. She only comes to class sometimes but there is always a TA. Overall, a decent professor.

Rather than being an intellectual super-force she is more focused on the applications of her work. And for that, and her courage, I admire her. She is accessible, quick to reply and really honest. Her comments are useful and she is entertaining as a lecturer. I have learned more in other courses, but it is worth taking still.

She's an excellent professor! In the classroom, she is an inspirational teacher. She is well-prepared, gives great feedback on assignments (& does so in a timely manner), and adjusts well to different learning styles. She knows books are expensive & tries to provide digital materials.  I am very satisfied with my visits to her office hours.

Sara Goldrick-Rab, or SGR, is an academic force. She is a powerful combination of brilliance, integrity and passion. It was an honor to take a class with her. Class requires tremendous critical thinking ability, but she really helps foster it (more so than any other class I've taken). However, prepare to read like you're in law school.
Very passionate about higher education; Small class, so participation and being engaged is required; Very enjoyable; No exams

This class has a lot of reading and critical thinking involved but if you have any interest in the subject matter you'll find the work worth it. You will learn a lot and lectures are really interesting and engaging.

She's extremely passionate about higher ed policy topics, and it definitely shows in her teaching. She's fantastic at personally mentoring her students and teaching to their strengths. I've never had a better professor.

My best professor at UW. Goldrick-Rab genuinely cares about her class and you can definitely tell. She wants you to contribute your ideas to discussion, and if you do that the class will go by quickly and you'll learn more. Your ideas and thoughts are taken seriously as peers, and she is always available for a phone call. Always take her if you can

HIGHLY SUGGEST. Sara is incredibly passionate and knowledgeable in the subject. Lectures are extremely interesting, engaging. Social media, current events and research fuel challenging yet relaxed debates. An ideal learning atmosphere - her students will benefit not only from meaningful material, but also through Sara's connections in higher ed.

Professor Goldrick-Rab has the ability to tie her research with the teaching in class. This is not an easy class and the readings are very dense, but these are things we need to be able to read in higher education and assess them. This class for me was an eye opener for myself.

Professor Goldrick-Rab is an excellent professor. She shows real concern in her students success and understanding. She makes complicated information understandable and is always willing to meet with students. I learned a lot in her class, and would definitely take a class with her again.
Sara is a great professor, although I do not agree with most of her views on higher education, I appreciate that she brings both sides of the arguement to the forefront.

Professor Goldrick-Rab challenged me to think beyond my personal notions on the issues in higher education. She is very knowledgable in her field and a true activist scholar. Her passion is in advocating for more financial aid for low-income students. All readings are electronic and you spend zero dollars in her class! Definitely recommended!
Spends more time on twitter than on teaching. Her followers might think she is a rock star. Ask what her students think. Get it together now!

A truly inspiring educator who has pushed me to want to continue challenging the boundaries of education policy. She is challenging but supports students to the fullest and really facilitates student growth.

One of the few professors on campus that actually values and advocates for the input of students in decision-making inside and outside the classroom.  Also, one of the most responsive professors I've had, who cultivates a challenging atmosphere for her students by offering a course that uses the most up to date research/artticles.

She is one of a few people publishing quality research driven work in her tiny field. Because of this, she gets national recognition, and is arrogant and egotistical.  She isn't helpful when it comes to your work, and she is critical in ways that are not constructive and tactless.  She studies ed. to make a name for herself, not to change the world
If you go to class and don't have the popquizzes you don't have to do the readings. Easy tests, fun class and great teacher.

EXCEPTIONAL teacher!  Well-organized, clear, knowledgeable about a variety of disciplines and able to tie them together, approachable, kind, fair.  Readings were many, though all relevant and interesting.  Lectures were enjoyable & thought-provoking.  I'd recommend any class she teaches!
She's a great teacher, and you can tell she loves what she is teaching.

Great teacher. Pop-quizes make you do reading, but the reading is very interesting and informative and pop-quizes are common sense. She knows what she is talking about. Take her class or any class if at all possible.
Great Teacher!  Go to her office hours!
Huge ego. Yet, still a good teacher.
